summary: This document is a series of automated law enforcement database query responses from the FBI New York field office, dated August 19, 2019, regarding an individual named Michael A. Thomas. The queries check DMV records, registration, and criminal history databases as part of an investigation categorized under 'Violent Crime & Gangs'. The responses show the subject has a New Jersey driver's license, an expired New York vehicle registration, and a history of New York license suspensions, but no active warrants or parole/probation hits.

keyFacts: The FBI New York field office conducted database queries on Michael A. Thomas on August 19, 2019, as part of an investigation categorized under 'Violent Crime & Gangs' (TFO C19 90ANY3151227 90A-VIOLENT CRIME & GANGS).

The subject, Michael A. Thomas, holds an active New Jersey driver's license (expiring 06-30-2021) but has no New York driver's license and has a history of three New York license suspensions (2005, 2006, 2011) for failures to pay fines/assessments and answer a summons.
A New York vehicle registration under his name is listed as 'REGISTRATION EXPIRED'.

Database checks for NYS Parole, Probation, Order of Protection, and NCIC Person initially returned a 'HIT' based on a name match from a DCJS criminal history record, but a subsequent 'Hit Confirmation Request' to NCIC returned 'No hit', indicating no active warrant.
The document is a routine law enforcement record check with no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, or the underlying facts of the Epstein case.
